text: I’d like to know – if you were old enough to remember the blast – where were you, and what do you remember from that day? ⬇️

Today marks 42 years (hard to believe that many years have passed!) since Mount St. Helens blew its top. It tragically killed 57 people and forever altered the surrounding landscape. Our communities still feel the mighty impact of that historic eruption even to this day. https://t.co/TF8dLyHK3Y

As we mark National Military Appreciation Month, please join me in honoring the men and women who are serving—and have served—in our armed forces. We are forever grateful for their service in defense of our nation. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/6gNYsvtmKG
In the coming days, I will be posting a list of employers who will be attending the Jobs Fair on my website: https://t.co/iz85noUUXj. Be sure to check back as this list continues to be updated!
Employers interested in participating should email southwestwajobs@mail.house.gov or call my Vancouver office at (360) 695-6292.

WHEN: Wednesday, June 1st from 11AM – 2PM
WHERE: Clark County Event Center, Exhibition Hall B
ADDRESS: 17402 NE Delfel Road Ridgefield, WA 98642

I’m excited to host my 11th annual Jobs Fair on June 1st, where folks can meet employers and apply for jobs. This event is free and open to all residents of Southwest Washington—details below. https://t.co/ocoF5jkhpc

This week, his name, and those of 6 other Washington state fallen police officers, will be added to the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial. We will never forget their service and sacrifice. https://t.co/r6uuKb53x0
Our community mourned for Clark County sheriff’s Sgt. Jeremy Brown and his family last year when he lost his life in the line of duty. Continued ⬇️
